data.sampled: The option strategy being implemented is a bull put spread. This strategy involves selling a put option with a higher strike price and buying a put option with a lower strike price, both with the same expiration date. In this case, the $410 strike price call is being sold and the $404 strike price call is being bought, both with a premium. The goal of this strategy is to benefit from a relatively stable stock price, as the premium received from selling the higher strike price option can help offset the cost of buying the lower strike price option. If the stock price remains between the two strike prices at expiration, both options will expire worthless and the investor will retain the premium received from selling the call option.

prompt.content: Assume all contracts are for 100 shares. Answer with no explanation, only a classification. Given the expiration dates are the same, what is the name of the option strategy being implemented in the following? Sell 1 $410 strike price call at $1.05. Buy 1 $404 strike price call at $2.35.
